thread.title: Arsenal news: Danny Welbeck should start vs Bayern Munich – Rio Ferdinand | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Danny Welbeck should start vs Bayern Munich – Rio Ferdinand | Metro News

author: Mark Brus For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Danny Welbeck should start vs Bayern Munich – Rio Ferdinand | Metro News
text:
Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 14 Feb 2017 12:22 pm Arsene Wenger advised to start with Danny Welbeck vs Bayern (Picture: Getty) 
Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger has been advised to start Danny Welbeck against Bayern Munich by his former Manchester United team-mate Rio Ferdinand. ‘How can Gibbs be captain?!’ Man Utd legend Roy Keane TEARS into Arsenal flops 
The England international has only recently returned from a lengthy injury lay-off, but impressed in the Gunners’ recent 5-0 thrashing of Southampton in the FA Cup. 
Ferdinand is a big fan of what Welbeck offers, stating the belief that he always seemed to come alive in these big games during his time at Old Trafford. Danny Welbeck recently returned from injury for Arsenal (Picture: Getty) 
‘Arsenal should pick Danny Welbeck in their starting line-up tomorrow,’ Ferdinand wrote in his column for the London Evening Standard . 
‘He had a knack when he was at Manchester United of playing well in key games away from home. For example, I remember him scoring against Real Madrid in the Bernabeu in the last 16 four years ago. 
‘He was probably our best player that night and gave Bayern problems a year later in the quarter-finals. Knowing Danny, he has probably reminded the Arsenal coaches of this and I wouldn’t be surprised if he starts.
